result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristal T Latham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

STAYED.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED TO DNA SURCHARGE.
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Walmart, Kohls or Jasmyne O.
Attend Criminal Thinking course. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Restitution of $5,711.64 to be paid as follows: jointly and severally - $5,571.88 to Kohl's and $139.76 to Walmart - As a Condition of Probation.

Attorney Eryn Menden in court.   Defendant Cristal T Latham did not appear at 3:14 p.m..    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only. Case recalled. Defendant is now present. Same appearances by all other parties. Court reinstates bail (not revoked) and quashes the capias (not issued). Read-in list filed by the State. Defense is not aware of this read-in list. Court will take a short recess. Court reconvenes. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 2 months (Initial Confinement: 14 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  - consecutive to Ct. 2 and any other sentence Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $5,571.88 to be paid to Kohl's joint and severally and $139.76 to be paid to Walmart to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00  - APPLY BAIL- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with Walmart, Kohls or Jasmyne O.. Criminal Thinking.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 -  120 days jail -  1st 90 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing July 30, 2015. Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 30 days jail STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 3 years 2 months (Initial Confinement: 14 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  - consecutive to Ct. 1 and any other sentence Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived on Ct. 2
 Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..
